state.description: What state the location is in. Note: Western Australia is split up into two regions, `wa_nw` is North-West Western Australia, `wa_sw` is South-West Western Australia

averageCottonYield.description: Average cotton yield, in t/ha (tonnes per hectare)

averageWeightPerBaleKg.description: Average weight of unprocessed cotton per bale, in kg

cottonLintPerBaleKg.description: Average weight of cotton lint per bale, in kg

cottonSeedPerBaleKg.description: Average weight of cotton seed produced per bale, in kg

wastePerBaleKg.description: Average weight of cotton waste produced per bale, in kg

ureaApplication.description: Urea application, in kg Urea/ha (kilograms of urea per hectare)

otherFertiliserApplication.description: Other N fertiliser application, in kg/ha (kilograms per hectare)

nonUreaNitrogen.description: Non-urea nitrogen application, in kg N/ha (kilograms of nitrogen per hectare)

ureaAmmoniumNitrate.description: Urea-Ammonium nitrate application, in kg product/ha (kilograms of product per hectare)

phosphorusApplication.description: Phosphorus application, in kg P/ha (kilograms of phosphorus per hectare)

potassiumApplication.description: Potassium application, in kg K/ha (kilograms of potassium per hectare)

sulfurApplication.description: Sulfur application, in kg S/ha (kilograms of sulfur per hectare)

singleSuperPhosphate.description: Single superphosphate use, in kg/ha (kilograms per hectare)

rainfallAbove600.description: Is there enough rainfall or irrigation to drain through the soil profile, typically above 600mm

fractionOfAnnualCropBurnt.description: Fraction of annual production of crop that is burnt, from 0 to 1

herbicideUse.description: Total amount of active ingredients from general herbicide/pesticide use, in kg (kilogram)

glyphosateOtherHerbicideUse.description: Total amount of active ingredients from other herbicide use (Paraquat, Diquat, Glyphosate), in kg (kilogram)

electricityAllocation.description: Percentage of electricity use to allocate to this crop, from 0 to 1

limestoneFraction.description: Fraction of lime as limestone vs dolomite, between 0 and 1
